sentences.english: Those embezzlers and grafters who are reckless with greed must be dealt with seriously in accordance with the policy.
sentences.chinese: 利慾薰心的貪污盜竊分子，一定要按照政策嚴肅處理。

sentences.english: Confucius's values on desire for gain was an important part of his theory.
sentences.chinese: 利慾觀是孔子學說中的一個重要部分。

sentences.english: He was blinded by the lust of lucre .
Races which are petrified in dogma or demoralized by lucre are unfit to guide civilization.
sentences.chinese: 被教條僵化或被利慾腐蝕的民族不適宜領導文化。

sentences.english: The careerism and money seemed only to embolden their blindness.
sentences.chinese: 利慾薰心與金錢看上去僅僅加重了他們的盲目愚昧。

sentences.english: It cut muscle, 46 of the unite feelings.
sentences.chinese: 不覺寒暑之切肌，利慾之感情。

sentences.english: Driven by their greed for money, some officials often put their political careers on the line.
sentences.chinese: 由於利慾薰心，有些官員常常拿自己的政治生涯冒險。

definition: lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
wine, sex, avarice and temper (idiom); four cardinal vices
faulted at every turn (idiom); can't get anything right
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face/to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk
